speaker: Skyline
text: An orange moon rises above the cityscape, taking on the face of a grinning Jack-O-Lantern. _ACT ONE  Scene One - KACL Roz is in Frasier's booth, setting up for the show.  The room is decorated for Halloween.  Bulldog comes into the booth, laughing._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Roz... _Several employees pass by the open door laughing and congratulating Bulldog._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hi, hi, hi.  Roz, you just missed the classic prank of all time.  I'll admit it, this was my masterpiece.

speaker: Roz
text: [_excited_] Oh, who, who?  Who'd you get?!

speaker: Bulldog
text: OK...

speaker: Employee
text: Way to go, Bulldog!

speaker: Kenny
text: There he is! [_slams chests and slaps hands with Bulldog_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: I got this friend down at the impound lot, who came across a smashed-up BMW, same make and model as Frasier's.

speaker: Roz
text: You didn't!  You got Frasier!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I had his car towed from the garage, the wreck went in its place.

speaker: Kenny
text: The doc totally freaked when he saw it.  First he started swearing, and then he implored the heavens, and just when his lip started trembling, Bulldog comes out, tells him it's all a prank.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey - Bulldog observes the mercy rule.  Besides, I got the whole thing on tape. _He proudly holds up the tape.  Then Frasier comes in, stone-faced. Kenny runs out while Roz hastily turns back to her work._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Admit it, Doc, I got you good. _Frasier says nothing.  He stares through Bulldog and starts setting up for the show.  Roz ducks into her booth._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Come on, [_slaps Frasier's backside_] say it: Bulldog's the best. [_no response_] OK, OK, how �bout the bitch dance I taught you? [_giggles, still nothing_] Well, at least give me one up high! _He raises his hand up for a high-five.  Frasier grabs his wrist, twists his arm behind his back, and pushes him out of the booth._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Come on - oh, come on, don't leave me hanging, Doc!  Where's your Halloween spirit? _Frasier shuts the door in his face and sits at his console.  Bulldog re-enters, hand still raised._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Don't worry, it'll be here waiting for you. _He leaves.  Frasier gets up and stalks into Roz's booth, stamping each word out of cold steel._

speaker: Frasier
text: For the record, I knew immediately it was not my car.  Mine has a bumper sticker on it that says, "I AM PRO OPERA AND I VOTE!"

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, you've got to admit, it was clever.

speaker: Frasier
text: I admit nothing.  That is the last we shall discuss of it, we have a show to do.

speaker: Roz
text: OK. _Frasier goes on the air.  As he speaks, he removes some books from his briefcase and starts flipping through them._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good afternoon, Seattle, and welcome to the Halloween edition of the Dr. Frasier Crane Show.  Today we will be discussing the topic... of fears.  Are they irrational hindrances, or evolutionary tools?  Hmmm...  the surprising answer, after these words. _He goes to commercial.  But someone has loaded the wrong cart into the player..._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on tape; wailing_] My car!  Ohhhh, no - my caaar!  What did they do to you?!  Oh, my bay-beee...! _Frasier glares at Roz, who holds up her hands to show she had nothing to do with it.  Frasier stabs the stop button on the player.  Bulldog re-enters, hand still raised._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whenever you're ready. _He leaves, waving goodbye with his raised hand.  Frasier glares after him as Roz tries to control her laughter.  FADE OUT_ **IS IT OCTOBER 31ST AGAIN?** _Scene Two - The Montana Niles's apartment at the Montana, Halloween night.  Someone is ringing the doorbell insistently and knocking as well. Niles does not answer, instead he just peers through the spy hole. Daphne tiptoes in carrying a bowl.  They both whisper to each other._

speaker: Niles
text: Did you find something?

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you think they'll take soy sauce packets? _Niles thinks, then shakes his head.  Gertrude strides in, not knowing why she should keep her voice down._

speaker: Gertrude
text: Who keeps ringing the doorbell?

speaker: Daphne
text: Shh!  It's trick or treaters.

speaker: Niles
text: OK, they're gone.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, why didn't you let them in?

speaker: Daphne
text: Because someone forgot to get Halloween candy.

speaker: Niles
text: Although, someone else could have picked it up since she was already in the store.

speaker: Daphne
text: But, that would override the duty list that someone insisted on implementing. [_smiles_]

speaker: Gertrude
text: If this is what you two call a fight, you're not fit to be married.  I once held your father's head underwater, and-

speaker: Daphne
text: Shh!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, for heaven's sake! [_through the door_] We haven't got any candy, shove off!

speaker: Niles
text: Great, now they know we're here.

speaker: Gertrude
text: That is precisely what's wrong with this country, everyone's afraid to stand up to the children.

speaker: Jason
text: Trick-or-treat!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Didn't you hear?  We've got no candy!

speaker: Niles
text: [_clearly scared_] We can offer you hotel soaps.

speaker: Jason
text: But it's Halloween.  I dress up, you give me candy.

speaker: Gertrude
text: That costume's supposed to be scary?

speaker: Jason
text: No, is yours? _Niles bites his fingers, afraid of what the boy is stirring in his mother-in-law._

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, a nice bite into an onion is what that mouth of yours deserves.

speaker: Jason
text: If you don't have treats, you're going to get a trick.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Do your worst!  I'm not afraid of you. [_shuts the door in his face_] Honestly!

speaker: Niles
text: OK, well, maybe I'll go get some candy after all. _He heads toward the door, but freezes when he hears the unmistakable sound of EGGS whapping against the door.  He hears three whaps, then nothing.  He cracks the door and slowly opens it... and jerks backward as a fourth egg hits the door.  He shuts it and walks up the stairs._

speaker: Niles
text: OK, I'm going to need my slicker and my squash goggles! **OKAY, WHAT IF THE BALLOON WERE BLUE?** _Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa Roz is sat at a center table.  Frasier comes in with his briefcase. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning, Roz.  May I join you?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure, Frasier.  Well, I'm glad to see you're not sulking today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I had a little time to think about it, and I've decided to put Bulldog's prank behind me...

speaker: Roz
text: That's very mature.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not finished! - by visiting upon him a prank that is ten times more dastardly.  Look at this. _He opens his briefcase and shows her a legal pad, on which he has carefully drawn a picture of a car with a red balloon tied to the antenna.  Roz stares, wondering if she's missing something._

speaker: Roz
text: Looks like a car with a balloon tied to it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Precisely.  I will tie a red balloon to the antenna of Bulldog's car every time his precious Seahawks- _He flips to the next page of the pad, showing what looks like a football strategy chart, the kind that a coach would draw on a locker room blackboard._

speaker: Frasier
text: -lose a game.  Over time, the conditioned response will become ingrained in his psyche.  Eventually, the mere sight of a red balloon-

speaker: Frasier
text: -will bring about in him an inexplicable sense... _Flip to the last page, showing a picture of Bulldog's face with tears streaming down it, attached to a thought bubble with a red balloon inside it._

speaker: Frasier
text: ...of loss. [_drops the pad into his briefcase_] Check-and-mate!

speaker: Roz
text: [_stares for a second, then:_] Isn't that... kind of out there?

speaker: Frasier
text: That's the point.  Well, of course, I could go with any one of your basic pranks - hand in warm water, and whatnot - believe me, I have an intimate knowledge of all of them.  But what I'm looking for is something unmistakably ME.  A signature prank, if you will.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you just forget about revenge and give him his two minutes in the sun?

speaker: Frasier
text: What, at my expense?

speaker: Roz
text: Look at his life!  You guys used to be equals, now he's stuck downstairs in that dark, musty archives room.  You must have some sympathy for him, don't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: "Dark, musty archives"...  I think I could use that! _He grabs his legal pad and starts drawing on a fresh page.  Niles, Daphne, and Gertrude come in._

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Why do we have to stop here?  I could make coffee at home.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, it's good to get out of the house, get some fresh air, exercise those lungs.

speaker: Gertrude
text: My lungs are as strong as ever.  Just yesterday, I finished a whole cigarette in two drags. [_off their shocked looks_] One off me record!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_sees Frasier's pad_] What's this?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm devising the ultimate prank, to get my revenge on Bulldog.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, well just beware the dangers of juvenile one-upsmanship. Only last night, Mrs. Moon challenged a trick-or-treater, and he responded by pelting our door with eggs.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yeah, but I got the little monster back, by putting a big, greasy glob of Vaseline on his doorknob! _Frasier chuckles with her, but Niles and Daphne are appalled. Clearly, they didn't know about this._

speaker: Niles
text: You said you'd put an end to it!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Hence the Vaseline.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, he's a child!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, it's time he learned you don't mess with Gertrude Moon without incurring my wrath.  Now, excuse me, I require cocoa.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I think she has the right attitude.  If I expect Bulldog to leave me alone, I've got to show him that he's dealing with a superior intellect.

speaker: Roz
text: Show them the balloon car. _Frasier glares at her, then drops the pad into his briefcase and primly snaps it shut._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure Da Vinci's early notes were full of laughs too! [_gets up_] Excuse me, I have devising to do! _At the counter, Gertrude receives her cocoa from the Barista (the same unflappable one from[[9.19]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_19/deathtrap.html) "Deathtrap"), who then refers to a bill. _

speaker: Barista
text: That'll be... $32.03.

speaker: Gertrude
text: For one drink?!

speaker: Barista
text: Your grandson ordered a bunch of cakes, and he said it was all on you. _He points over her shoulder.  She turns and sees Jason, laden with BAGS and grinning._

speaker: Jason
text: Thanks for the treats, Grandma! _He runs out, with a livid Gertrude in hot pursuit.  Daphne and Niles moan and droop in their seats.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - The Montana Back to Niles's apartment.  Gertrude comes in, cackling to herself.  She's wearing heavy gloves and an oil-stained mechanic's smock, carrying a BICYCLE'S FOOT PEDAL ASSEMBLY, with the chain still dangling from it._

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, let's see the little sod get to school without these. Oh, this should settle it! _She goes to her room, laughing evilly... not noticing the HUGE GOB OF SHAVING CREAM dripping out of the air vent above the hallway.  FADE TO:_ **STORAGE ROOM OF TERROR**  [_Over the black screen we hear the boom of thunder, and the screen flashes white two times._] _Scene Five - KACL Storage Room The storage room in the basement of KACL where Bulldog now works. It is pitch dark.  Martin slowly opens the door from the stairwell and comes in hesitantly._

speaker: Martin
text: Is anybody there? _FOUR ZOMBIES rise from behind the stacked boxes and stagger towards him._

speaker: Martin
text: [_acting_] Oh, zombies... the living dead.  Help, help!

speaker: Frasier
text: Everyone, hold please. _The lights come up.  The four zombies - three men and one woman - are actors, wearing tattered costumes and cadaver makeup.  Frasier is standing in the corner of the room, behind a viewing screen on a tripod.  The screen is connected to a camera mounted in a corner of the ceiling.  Wires crisscross the floor, connected to the screen and other film set devices.  Roz comes down the stairs and stands next to Martin._

speaker: Frasier
text: Zombie Number Two, what are you doing?

speaker: Zombie 2
text: I'm scaring Bulldog?

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Is that what zombies do, they scare people?

speaker: Zombie 2
text: Um...

speaker: Frasier
text: Wrong.  They eat brains, and THAT'S what scares people.  Now, look, this is our dress rehearsal, let's please try to get this right.  Bulldog comes in, he hears noises, zombies go after his brain, and his terror is caught on videotape for us all to enjoy at a later date.  Now, let's try this again. First marks, please.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, jeez, Fras, this is the fourth time through.  Can somebody else play Bulldog now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you said you would help me with this.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's because you said we were gonna do a practical joke.  I thought it would be fun.

speaker: Frasier
text: Whatever gave you that idea? [_to one of the actors_] Todd, I am getting "dead" from you.  But I am not getting "undead."

speaker: Todd
text: [_bored_] Still?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's try this then.  After rehearsal, I want each of you to write a paragraph detailing who your character was when he or she was alive, how they died, and why they're now after Bulldog's brain.

speaker: Frasier
text: Honestly, Roz, you know, you haven't given me much to work with here.  These are the worst actors I've ever seen.

speaker: Roz
text: [_annoyed_] Well, I'm sorry, but the Royal Zombie Company just left town with its all-zombie production of "Hamlet"!

speaker: Martin
text: How many more times are we going to do this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why is it that whenever Bulldog pulls off a practical joke, you all applaud him, as if he'd won some sort of bowl or cup or other sports dish?  But when I ask you to give up a single Sunday, all I get is complaints?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, because you keep turning it into work!  This is supposed to be fun!  Like a day at the beach!  Oh, you do this kind of thing all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Like when?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the last time we went to the beach!

speaker: Frasier
text: A lot of people bring rakes!

speaker: Roz
text: Look, Frasier, it's not too late to back out of this.  Face it, jokes just aren't your specialty.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what she means, son, is that we all have our different blessings.  And Bulldog's good at jokes and fun, and you're good at... reading, and, uh... telling people about the things you read.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you saying that you think I can't pull this off?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I wouldn't put it that way.

speaker: Martin
text: I would.

speaker: Frasier
text: But I've worked this out to the last detail, nothing can go wrong!

speaker: Roz
text: Everything's gonna go wrong!  For one thing, Bulldog's gonna know something's up, �cause Kenny hardly ever makes him work at night!  And then look at all these cameras and all these wires, I mean, what if he spots these?

speaker: Martin
text: And the zombies, as soon as he sees them he's gonna know it's a prank, because he just pranked you! [_composure cracks_] _And there are no such things as zombies!!!_

speaker: Frasier
text: You, sir... are released!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Roz_] And you as well! _She leaves, following Martin up the stairs.  Frasier sticks his head through the door and yells up the stairs._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll pull this thing off by myself, proving you don't know what you're talking about!  I don't need any of you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, zombies, I do need you! [_up the stairs_] But no one else! I'll show all of you!  You mark my words, tomorrow night I get my revenge! _As if to mark his point, a crack of thunder comes from one of the machines sitting on a box, which then starts to blow misty smoke._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, good, the effects machine's working again. [_claps hands_] All right, everyone, back to your first marks. _The zombies wearily resume their places as Frasier returns to the camera._ [_N.B. Kelsey Grammer is no doubt perfectly familiar with all this equipment by now, having directed many episodes himself._] _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Six - The Montana At Niles's apartment, Gertrude is pacing in the living room when someone knocks on the door.  She opens it to a Courier._

speaker: Gertrude
text: Where have you been?

speaker: Courier
text: I'm sorry, I had a hard time finding this place.  I checked the directory for "Crane," but it had "Old Bat" next to this apartment number.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_to herself_] A little obvious, but not bad.

speaker: Gertrude
text: I want you to deliver this "Baby-I-Have-To-Tinkle" doll to Jason White, Floyd Middle School. [_gives him a paper_] This is the address.  I mean, he should be in gym class about now.

speaker: Courier
text: I don't think I'm allowed to just walk into his school, ma'am.

speaker: Gertrude
text: No, it's OK.  I'm his grandmother. [_points to the paper_] And you have to say this.

speaker: Courier
text: [_reading_] "Your mommy said, bring this to you at school to lift your spirits.  See?  A dolly has accidents too."  You really want me to say that?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Yes, and very loudly.  The poor thing's hard-of-hearing.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_raises both fists_] Yes! **TALES FROM THE CRYPT** _Scene Seven - KACL Frasier is sitting in his booth, which has been modified to a director's booth.  On a small television is a black-and-white image from the ceiling-mounted camera in the basement.  Frasier is wearing a headset radio, and also has a control panel in front of him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Todd, take off that baseball cap.  You're undead, not uncouth. _On the screen, Todd removes his baseball cap and signals acknowledgement at the camera.  Behind Frasier, Martin and Roz enter the booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, everyone, step lively, look sharp.  It's almost showtime.  Give me a final room tone check, please, and... take your marks.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... hello.  You've come to watch me fail, I suppose.

speaker: Roz
text: No, we just want to come join you.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, we're sorry about that stuff we said yesterday.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, we came to see you have your day.  It's long overdue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maybe I don't want you here.

speaker: Roz
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: You abandon me in my hour of need, now you're here to revel in my success, just like in Boswell's "Life of Johnson."

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: It was something-I-read.

speaker: Martin
text: I guess we deserved that - whatever the hell it means.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, Frasier, we're sorry.  Just let us watch.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, apology accepted.  You may observe - in silence. Make yourselves comfortable. _They stand behind him, eyes on the screen - and struggling to hide their smiles.  Frasier focuses evilly on the screen, looking for all the world like Dr. Frankenstein as he manipulates his control panel._

speaker: Frasier
text: And prepare to witness a man brought to the very edge of

speaker: Martin
text: [_in Roz's ear_] I think he's already there. _FADE TO:  Scene Eight - The Montana Gertrude is reading on the couch.  Niles and Daphne come down, dressed for an evening out._

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, we're off to the symphony.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Haven't the Germans punished us enough? _Niles opens the door - and a GARBAGE CAN that was leaning against the door tips inside, spilling trash all over the floor._

speaker: Niles/Daphne
text: Oh!/Bloody hell!

speaker: Niles
text: Where did this come from?

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_innocently_] Oh, you must have crossed someone.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_not fooled_] Mother...

speaker: Donald
text: Oh my God!  I'm so sorry!  We were just coming down the hall, and we saw you open your door.  This is our trash can!

speaker: Daphne
text: What was it doing there?

speaker: Beverly
text: [_out into the hall_] Jason, get back here! [_to Niles_] It seems our children have been feuding.  We're very embarrassed.

speaker: Niles
text: You're embarrassed?  Meet our daughter. _He motions into the room.  The Whites are somewhat taken aback to see a sixtyish woman sitting there._

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_waves cheerfully_] Hello!

speaker: Jason
text: I have a lot of homework...

speaker: Beverly
text: Stay!

speaker: Donald
text: Jason, have you been fighting with this woman?

speaker: Jason
text: Well, she broke my bike and made me have to see a counselor at school! _Now Donald and Beverly look appalled, and Gertrude is the one on the spot._

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_gets up_] I think I left something in the kitchen...

speaker: Daphne
text: Stay!

speaker: Gertrude
text: I am an adult!  I can do anything I want! [_stamps her foot_]

speaker: Niles
text: No.  While you're living under our roof, you'll follow our rules.

speaker: Daphne
text: You two should be ashamed of yourselves.  What if someone got hurt?

speaker: Jason
text: Good.

speaker: Beverly
text: Jason!  You are one step away from losing your broadband connection.  Now apologize and shake hands.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_putting her arms on her hips_] Pish.

speaker: Niles
text: What if I told you you couldn't smoke your pipes in your room anymore?

speaker: Gertrude/Jason
text: [_mumbling_] I'm sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Now, you two are going to clean up this mess.

speaker: Beverly
text: And Jason, come straight home when you're finished.

speaker: Daphne
text: And this place better be spotless by the time we get back. _She steps out the door.  Niles stops and points a warning finger at both of them, before following her._

speaker: Jason
text: I wish I was all grown-up, and I wouldn't have to follow their stupid rules!

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, nothing changes, trust me.

speaker: Jason
text: You know... my mom hates bugs.  She screams like a girl.

speaker: Gertrude
text: [_elbows him_] So does my son-in-law!

speaker: Jason
text: I know where we can find some crickets.

speaker: Gertrude
text: No!  Now, we should do as we're told, and start cleaning up.

speaker: Jason
text: OK.

speaker: Gertrude
text: That way, they won't be expecting it! _She and Jason laugh as they start to pick up the garbage.  FADE TO:_ **NO ZOMBIES WERE HARMED IN THE FILMING OF THIS EPISODE** _Scene Nine - KACL Frasier is still at his console.  By now, Kenny has joined Martin and Roz behind him, and all three of them are twitching with excitement._

speaker: Kenny
text: This is so great!  I can't wait!  I'm getting goose bumps! [_holds out his arm and rolls up his sleeve_] Feel me, feel me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny, what was the condition of my letting you watch? _Kenny puts a finger to his lips and retreats to the back.  On the screen, Bulldog comes into the storage room._

speaker: Frasier
text: There he is.  Cue creaking noise one... [_presses a button on the panel_] _CUT TO: the Storage Room As before, the room is dimly lit.  But unlike the rehearsal scene, here the effect is genuinely eerie - even more so when Bulldog hears a soft creaking noise._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hello?  Who's there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Cue creaking noise two. [_presses another button_] _CUT TO: Storage Room  Bulldog hears another creaking noise, louder and yet more distant. He looks around nervously.  CUT TO: Booth_

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, let the horror begin... [_presses another button_] _CUT TO: Storage Room:  The zombies rise from behind the boxes and stagger towards Bulldog.  He gives a yelp of terror and backpedals.  CUT TO: Booth  Roz, Martin, and Kenny laugh, as Frasier glows with evil triumph._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  How do you like that, ya big baby! [_laughs_] _CUT TO: Storage Room  Bulldog screams as the zombies corner him against a wall.  He reaches down, rips through a cabinet, and holds up a REVOLVER._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Get back! _CUT TO: Booth  Frasier and the others look at the screen, suddenly shocked, hearing Bulldog's yelling - and then a GUNSHOT!  On the screen, they see Todd collapse onto his back._

speaker: Frasier
text: OH MY GOD!  OH MY GOD! [_tears off his headphones and rushes out_] CALL 9-1-1, CALL 9-1-1! _Kenny grabs the phone and dials frantically - but as soon as Frasier is gone, Roz starts laughing._

speaker: Martin
text: Don't worry about it, Kenny!  It's just a joke!

speaker: Kenny
text: What are you talking about?!

speaker: Martin
text: It's a fake gun!

speaker: Kenny
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: It's-a-fake-gun!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_still unsure_] What about the bullets?

speaker: Roz
text: It's a joke!  Bulldog found out about Frasier's prank, so we set him up!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_laughing_] That is awesome!  I can't believe he fell for it!

speaker: Roz
text: Come on, we got to go tell Frasier what's going on!

speaker: Kenny
text: You guys go ahead... [_Roz and Martin run out_] I think I'm gonna stay here and puke. _CUT TO: Storage Room As the other three zombies flee the room, screaming, Todd lies on his back on the floor.  Bulldog still has the gun when Frasier comes tearing in.  Roz and Martin are right behind him, followed shortly by Kenny._

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop!  Stop!  It was all a joke!  Oh my God, what have I done?!

speaker: Martin
text: What's the big deal, he was already a zombie! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you insane?!  Call an ambulance! _Todd bolts up and grabs Frasier, making him yell and jump.  Bulldog, Martin, Roz, and Kenny laugh uproariously._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is going on here?

speaker: Roz
text: [_points_] Wave to the camera, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Got you again, all on tape.  Who's the king? _There's laughter all around, except from Todd, who gets up and leans back against the wall, staggering slightly._

speaker: Frasier
text: That isn't funny, I could have had a heart attack!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sorry, Fras, we just couldn't resist.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, at least nobody was hurt.  You bested me, Bulldog, again! _Todd steps forward, reaching behind his back with his hands as if trying to scratch._

speaker: Todd
text: Dr. Crane, I think I hurt my back...

speaker: Frasier
text: What? _Todd suddenly collapses forward, showing a SCISSORS HANDLE sticking out of his back.  Everyone GASPS.  ALL SCREAMING:_

speaker: Roz
text: OH MY GOD!!!

speaker: Martin
text: WHAT HAVE WE DONE?!

speaker: Kenny
text: SOMEONE CALL AN AMBULANCE!

speaker: Martin
text: WHERE'S THE PHONE?!  WHERE'S THE PHONE?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, get the first aid kit out of the closet!

speaker: Roz
text: OK!  OK! [_runs over_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no, not the-! _Roz opens the closet and SHRIEKS as she sees Noel hanging inside the door by a MEAT HOOK impaled through his bloody chest._

speaker: Martin
text: _WHAT THE HELL'S GOING ON DOWN HERE?!?!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Quiet, quiet, everybody! [_into phone_] Hello?  Yes, I'd like to report... THE GREATEST PRACTICAL JOKE EVER!  You'd better send a fire truck, because you guys just got BURNED!  AH-HA-HA-HA- HA-HA-HAAAAAA! _Frasier and Bulldog laugh while everyone else stares at them, open- mouthed._

speaker: Roz
text: Wait, what?!

speaker: Noel
text: [_looking up_] Hi, Roz!

speaker: Bulldog
text: You should see the look on your faces!  This is truly a classic!

speaker: Martin
text: This was all just a joke?

speaker: Kenny
text: Awesome!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Nice work, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise, Bulldog. [_they shake hands_]

speaker: Todd
text: You think I can get a copy of this for my demo reel?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pats him on the shoulder_] Sure thing, Todd.  You've come a long way in a short time, young man. _As Todd walks out, Martin plucks the scissors out of the foam pad underneath his jacket.  The blades were splayed out so as to flatten against his back instead of pointing in._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, Frasier, I'm speechless!  You totally had us going!

speaker: Roz
text: I can't believe it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Admit it, Roz, can I pull off a practical joke, or what?

speaker: Roz
text: I just don't understand it, you guys worked together?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, Frasier set the whole thing up.

speaker: Frasier
text: The other day, after you two left, I got to thinking maybe my joke was aimed at the wrong target.  That's when Bulldog and I joined forces!

speaker: Roz
text: But we joined forces with him to get you!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's exactly what you were supposed to think!

speaker: Martin
text: Wow, Fras, I got to give it to you - this was brilliant!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad.  What do you say we all go upstairs and watch the tape, huh? _Everyone agrees enthusiastically and runs upstairs.  Bulldog stays behind to get his jacket from the closet._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you guys go ahead.  Bulldog?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah?

speaker: Frasier
text: Technically, I still owe you one

speaker: Bulldog
text: Face it, Doc, you will never win. [_to Noel, who is still hanging on the door_] Good work, Noel. _Bulldog closes the closet door (replacing Noel inside) and puts on his jacket._

speaker: Bulldog
text: That's why you had to join forces with me.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.

speaker: Bulldog
text: All right. _Bulldog heads up the stairs, totally unaware of the "I'M PRO OPERA AND I VOTE" sticker affixed to the back of his jacket.  Frasier chuckles deviously to himself and follows him up._
